path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Verichains_Lab/Verichains Public Audit Report - RiceWallet IOS Application - v1.1.pdf

findings.title: Unsafe time measurement which can lead to unrestricted passcode bruteforce
findings.description: Using Date() based time measuring in PasscodeUtil.swift allows attackers to modify system datetime and bypass restrictions, enabling passcode bruteforcing and potential theft of mnemonic seed and private key.

findings.title: Unsafe direct call to keychain
findings.description: The currentPasscode() function may return nil if Keychain is not ready, causing the passcode screen overlay to be dismissed. This can be triggered by entering 5 characters of passcode, locking the device for a long enough time, and then unlocking it and immediately inputting the last character.

findings.title: Unsecure sensitive data store in memory without cleanup
findings.description: Password and private key are stored in-memory using swift's String type, which does not clean up when released back to system, later process may read the plain data stored later.
